notes.note: Typographic distinctions including logograms (e.g., & → and), ligatures (e.g., æ → ae), archaic letters (e.g., ſ → s), u/v/w variants (e.g., vv → w, u → v), i/j variants (j → i) were normalized and not reported as differences.
A total of 37 character-level variations related to 3 logogram instances, 10 archaic letter instances, 19 u/v/w instances were identified and normalized based on the comparison settings.
